strings: <se_low>Yangus: So we're 'ere to find that Rylus geezer, right?

<se_low>Yangus: Leave it to me!
I'm an ace when it comes to findin' people.

<se_low>Yangus: I don't like the sound o' this!
I reckon I know wot this monster thing's all about...

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv!
We better go an' take a look!
<se_low>Yangus: Wot's that all about, eh!? She's askin' us a favour! Ain't she scared o' the old codger? I mean, he's pretty monstrous-lookin'.

<se_low>Yangus: Anyway, she said 'er place was by the well, right?
Best go take a look, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder why that Valentina girl asked us to find 'er a crystal ball, eh? D'ya think she don't 'ave no one else to ask?<page>Yangus: Anyway, we've turned 'er down now.

<se_low>Yangus: But wot d'ya think we should do?
Go back to 'er place, or leave town?
<se_low>Yangus: We agreed to go an' find a crystal ball for that Valentina girl, right?

<se_low>Yangus: Then let's get goin'!
Only...I s'pose we better go an' tell the old codger wot's 'appenin' first.

<se_low>Yangus: He ain't me favourite bloke in the world, but 'e is yer boss.
We can't get away wiv ignorin' 'im.
<se_low>Yangus: We agreed to go an' find a crystal ball for that Valentina girl, right?
<se_low>Yangus: Erm...didn't she say it was in some cave under a big waterfall?

<se_low>Yangus: Diamond!
We got our 'ands on the goods!
Now to deliver 'em to Valentina!

<se_low>Yangus: D'ya remember where 'er 'ouse is?
I think it was next to the well, weren't it?
<se_low>Yangus: Kalderasha reckons Dhoulmagus 'eaded south out of Farebury.

<se_low>Yangus: As far as I remember, there's a village called Alexandria down that way.
Why don't we try our luck there?
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
<se_low>Yangus: Phew! Them kids layin' into us as soon as we arrived in the village threw me off a bit.
<se_low>Yangus: Mind you, looks like they'd 'ad some bother before, so ya can't blame 'em. I bet it's Dhoulmagus! He's at the bottom of all this.

<se_low>Yangus: Somefin's been botherin' me...
I know! That letter Munchie went an' got us.

<se_low>Yangus: Ain't it some last will an' testimony or somefin'?
Wotever, it ain't an 'appy read.

<se_low>Yangus: An' I don't think we was the one's who were meant to read it.
Wot are we gonna do wiv it?

<se_low>Yangus: Didn't that Bangerz kid tell us to go to some tower?
East of 'ere, weren't it?
<se_low>Yangus: I don't like bein' bossed around by kids, but I reckon we should 'ave another word wiv that Bangerz.
<se_low>Yangus: Weren't we s'posed to go an' find this girl called Jessica once that Bangerz kid 'ad opened up the gate for us?
<se_low>Yangus: It weren't exactly difficult to open though, was it? He coulda just told us, instead of comin' all that way wiv us and slowin' us down.

<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose I'm talkin' to the wrong person though, eh guv!? It ain't your fault.
Anyway, we better get to the tower.
<se_low>Yangus: Nah, that Jessica bird we ran into at the top o' the tower ain't really my type.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm sure she's got a lot to offer, but I need a girl who's a bit more racy.
You know, a bit spicy, like.
<se_low>Yangus: Anyway, she said she'd be waitin' back in Alexandria, didn't she?
<se_low>Yangus: That kid Bangerz is awright, offerin' to pay for our accommodations an' ev'ryfin'.
<se_low>Yangus: ...So d'ya think that Jessica's got back 'ere to the village by now?

<se_low>Yangus: Looks like Jessica's scarpered, eh?
Guess she didn't realise we was about.
<se_low>Yangus: I 'ate birds like that who just go an' do stuff wivout thinkin'. She's all yours, guv. I'm stayin' well clear of 'er!
<se_low>Yangus: I'm gettin' more an' more fed up wiv this Jessica bird!
<se_low>Yangus: If you 'adn't agreed to get rid o' that monster for 'er, guv, I woulda said we should steer well clear o' the likes of 'er.

<se_low>Yangus: But seein' as you've agreed to it an' all, I s'pose there's no choice.
Let's sock it to 'im.
<se_low>Yangus: That Jessica tricked us good an' proper, eh!? We're in a tight spot now!<page>Yangus: Stuck on this ship wiv that nutcase monster who ain't best pleased wiv life by the sound of it!
<se_low>Yangus: I thought it'd be some little critter we could finish off easy, like. I didn't know we was gonna be up against trouble like this!

<se_low>Yangus: But there ain't no other way out now!
We've gotta beat it next time!
<se_low>Yangus: Up against you and me, that monster didn't stand a chance! Goes wivout sayin', eh guv!?

<se_low>Yangus: Now the ferries can start runnin' again.
And we can get after Dhoulmagus!

<se_low>Yangus: ...But 'ang on a minute!
Where'd Jessica get to?
<se_high>Jessica: Okay, then. We know Dhoulmagus came here, but which way did he go next?

<se_high>Jessica: Huh? Why are you lookin' at me like that?
Like you don't know who I am!
You can't have forgotten me already!

<se_high>Jessica: Ha ha! Had you fooled!
I know you wouldn't forget ME!
We're friends now, right?
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE

<se_low>Yangus: There's this place called Maella Abbey on a little island in the middle of a river. It's pretty famous.<page>Yangus: There's always a load o' travellin' priests an' that stayin' there.
<se_low>Yangus: Wiv so many people under one roof, maybe we'll find someone who knows somefin' about Dhoulmagus.
<se_low>Yangus: Simpleton's this tiny little one-'orse town in the 'ills. The pub ain't bad, mind.
<se_low>Yangus: Yeah, I could do wiv gettin' one down me neck.
<se_high>Jessica: Like I said! That self-important sleazeball, Angelo, is getting his cheap ring back whether he likes it or not!

<se_high>Jessica: He said he lived at Maella Abbey, right?
Well it won't be hard to find him!
We can just follow his slime trail!
<se_low>Yangus: I'd never o' guessed it when we saw 'im in Simpleton, but it looks like that bloke Angelo is some kinda knight or somefin' at Maella Abbey.

<se_low>Yangus: I guess that's where we'll find 'im then, eh?
We should go an' give 'im back that ring.
<se_low>Yangus: If that knight Angelo's tellin' the truth, there's someone who looks like Dhoulmagus in the abbey right now!

<se_low>Yangus: An' didn't 'e say 'e was goin' after the Abbot, Francisco?
We can't just stand 'ere doin' nuffin'!
<se_low>Yangus: Sounds like ya can't get to this Abbot geezer's 'ouse up the front path, but Angelo said there was, like, a secret passage to get round, right?

<se_low>Yangus: You know, from them ruins 'e was talkin' about, where the old abbey was.<page>Yangus: Follow the river bank along all the way, and that's where the entrance to the secret passage is, 'e said.

<se_low>Yangus: I never guessed Angelo's ring would be the key to open up a secret underground passage!
I thought I'd seen it all, but that's somefin' else!

<se_low>Yangus: Come on then! Let's get goin'!
The secret passage from the ruin's the only way to the Abbot geezer's little island.
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe that ghost we came across was a lost soul from the old abbey. All its inhabitants died when the plague came many years ago.

<se_high>Jessica: He doesn't even realise he's dead.
He's been stuck underground in suffering for centuries.

<se_high>Jessica: Poor thing. It's like a nightmare that goes on and on forever.
We've got to put an end to his suffering.

<se_low>Yangus: I weren't expectin' to find no ghost! I knew it was a bad idea from the start, tryin' to get to the abbey through some creepy old ruins.
Wot a shock!

<se_low>Yangus: But we 'elped 'im rest in peace, guv.
So the coast's clear, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: We should be able to get through now, no probs. The end o' the passage is s'posed to come out on the abbot's island, right?
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus wot set the bridge on fire an' no mistake!

<se_low>Yangus: He can walk on water, so it won't stop 'im!
He'll 'ave got to the Abbot by now and be tryin' to do 'im in!
<se_low>Yangus: Ain't you worried about Angelo goin' after Dhoulmagus on 'is own? We better get ourselves over to that island!
<se_def>Angelo: I'm going to be coming after Dhoulmagus with the rest of you. He has to pay for what he did to Abbot Francisco.

<se_def>Angelo: I hope we can all be friends.
So, why don't we use the world map to decide where to head next?

<se_high>Jessica: Let's not forget why we came here!
We just came to give that ring back to that smarmy cheat, Angelo.
<se_high>Jessica: But now we find out he and the Templar Captain are brothers! I can hardly believe it. There's something weird going on between them.
<se_high>Jessica: Anyway, I suppose we better try and find out what we can about Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe Abbot Francisco will know something.
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
<se_low>Yangus: Ascantha ain't got much goin' for it, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: Everyone dressed in black the 'ole time, never takin' a step outdoors!
Wot 'appened to the place!?
<se_high>Jessica: I suppose it's the Queen's death that sent the King into such a depression.
<se_high>Jessica: I can understand how he feels, but he can't run his kingdom like this forever.
<se_high>Jessica: The King's maid, Emma, seems to have a lot of confidence in this fairy tale she told us about. She's desperate enough to try anything.

<se_high>Jessica: But it all sounds a bit far-fetched to me.
I suppose the first thing to do is to go and talk to her grandmother who lives by the bridge.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot's this curious sight you can see on the mountain upstream then, eh?
Sounds int'restin'!
<se_low>Yangus: I say we go an' 'ave a look!

<se_high>Jessica: The shadow the moon cast on top of the hill looked like a sort of door.
I bet it leads somewhere!

<se_high>Jessica: So what are we doing back here!?
Let's go back and find out what's behind it!

<se_low>Yangus: I ain't never seen nuffin' like it!
A door made from a shadow!?
I thought I must be losin' me marbles!
<se_low>Yangus: And then it turns out you can go through the door and there's an 'ole other world behind it! I thought I'd lost me marbles and me 'ead an' 'all!
<se_high>Jessica: Now the people of Ascantha can finally carry on with their lives.
<se_high>Jessica: And I hear the King gave Emma some time off as well. A happy ending all round!

<se_high>Jessica: So...
Back to chasing Dhoulmagus, I guess!
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
<se_low>Yangus: Grandad's upset cos 'e always gets treated like a monster, and we ain't got no clue where Dhoulmagus is, neither.
<se_low>Yangus: I'm tellin' ya, we should go to me 'ometown, Pickham.
<se_low>Yangus: Grandad'll be able to go where 'e wants, an' I bet we'll get some stuff on Dhoulmagus an' all.

<se_low>Yangus: Pickham's roughly south of Ascantha.
It's a bit of a way, but it'll be worth it.
<se_low>Yangus: If the old codger wants to go off an' 'ave a bit o' fun, we best leave 'im to it, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: We'll go an' find Brains an' see if 'e knows somefin' about where Dhoulmagus is.
<se_def>Angelo: If this informer we came to see isn't around, there's nothing more to keep us in this town.

<se_def>Angelo: King Trode can't be too far away.
Let's pick him up and move on somewhere else.
We can't let Dhoulmagus get away.

<se_low>Yangus: Grandad keeps givin' me evils!
We better find the 'orse-princess quick!

<se_low>Yangus: Whoever nicked 'er can't 'ave got that far.
Let's look around town first.

<se_high>Jessica: That thief...Mitts, wasn't it?
If he was telling the truth, the Princess should be at the black marketeer's shop he mentioned.
<se_high>Jessica: What a lowlife, kidnapping the Princess and selling her on as if she were his own! We've got to get her back!
<se_low>Yangus: Looks like Red bought the 'orse-princess off Dodgy Dave.
<se_low>Yangus: She's a bandit 'erself. Used to live in a place west o' town in the middle of a lake. She's prob'ly still there.

<se_low>Yangus: It's the last place I wanna go, believe me.
But we ain't got a lot o' choice.
<se_low>Yangus: If we want the 'orse-princess back, we're gonna 'ave to get Red this gemstone called the Venus' tear, right?
<se_low>Yangus: It's in this cave north of 'er place.

<se_high>Jessica: Well it certainly wasn't easy!
But now we've got the Venus' tear, we can finally get the Princess back.

<se_high>Jessica: We should go and see Red straight away.
Poor Princess Medea must be so worried.
<se_def>Angelo: Well, we've got our four-legged Princess back. Next on the list was the informer in Pickham, wasn't it?
<se_def>Angelo: I can't say I feel overly confident about getting any useful information, but I suppose we should at least meet the man.
<se_high>Jessica: Brains told us to go back to Port Prospect and follow the coast to the west, right?
<se_high>Jessica: He said we'd find a marooned ship in the middle of a vast wilderness there.
<se_high>Jessica: So if we can just figure out a way to get it afloat again, we'll be able to carry on pursuing Dhoulmagus on the western continent. Simple!
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
<se_low>Yangus: Beats me wot a ship's doin' plonked down in the middle o' some desert.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we'll find out somefin' about it in the library at Trodain Castle, like Grandad said. It's up north o' the ship.
<se_low>Yangus: Best go an' 'ave a look, eh!?

<se_high>Jessica: Trodain covered in thorns...
Everyone in the castle cursed...
How low can Dhoulmagus go?
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard seeing everyone suffering like that, but I think we need to go back to Trodain again.
<se_high>Jessica: We might find some clues about the ship in the castle library.
<se_def>Angelo: If you feel inclined to believe the words of such a strange man from an equally strange world...
<se_def>Angelo: Ishmahri said he could move our ship with an instrument called the Moonshadow harp, didn't he?

<se_def>Angelo: Just one problem.
We don't know where the harp is.

<se_low>Yangus: So we reckon this Moonshadow 'arp's in some kingdom or other, right.
Only thing is, which kingdom?
<se_low>Yangus: Well Trodain ain't much of a kingdom no more. I can't remember where else we've met a king, though.<page>Yangus: Me mum used to say I'd forget me own 'ead if it weren't screwed on!
<se_def>Angelo: According to the Pickham fortune-teller, this Moonshadow harp we're looking for is somewhere on the southern continent.
<se_def>Angelo: But I'm fairly sure there's nothing like it at the abbey.
<se_high>Jessica: So some young king has the Moonshadow harp.
<se_high>Jessica: That's what Kalderasha saw in his crystal ball. We should be able to figure it out. A king... Hm...
<se_def>Angelo: Marcello seemed to think the Moonshadow harp was in Ascantha. Let's go and see how reliable his information is.
<se_def>Angelo: Well that's great! We get the King to agree to let us have the Moonshadow harp, only to find out it's been stolen!
<se_def>Angelo: A mysterious tunnel under the castle can only mean one thing! We've got to go down it, find the people who stole the harp, and take it back!

<se_low>Yangus: We've found their 'ideout now!
Them scoundrels wot stole the 'arp 'ave got it comin'!
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get down there an' take back wot don't belong to 'em! This is right up my street, this kinda thing!
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe it! The Moonshadow harp was stolen by a giant, rock star wannabe...mole!? His music must never be let out above ground!

<se_high>Jessica: We've got to defeat him and get the harp back.
For everyone's sake!
<se_high>Jessica: I didn't expect to have any trouble defeating a mole!
<se_high>Jessica: Let's show that tone-deaf, short-sighted freak who's boss and get our harp back!
<se_high>Jessica: Come on! Let's get back down that mole hole! I don't want to have to tell anyone a mole got the better of me!
<se_def>Angelo: Well we have the Moonshadow harp as ordered!<page>Angelo: Now all we have to do is get back to the library in Trodain and deliver it to the mysterious Moonshadow land!

<se_def>Angelo: Then Ishmahri will help us out with the ship.
That was the deal, I believe.
<se_low>Yangus: Gordon Bennett! That weren't easy, eh!? But now look at us, wiv our very own ship an' ev'ryfin'! Sweet as a nut!

<se_low>Yangus: That Dhoulmagus ain't got nowhere to 'ide now!
Wherever 'e runs to, we'll track 'im down!
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
<se_low>Yangus: We 'ad a bit o' luck there, findin' out that Dhoulmagus 'eaded to Baccarat, eh!

<se_low>Yangus: We can't afford to ignore it.
We've gotta search every last inch o' the place 'til we find 'im!
<se_high>Jessica: Wasn't there some talk about the Baccarat casino owner having been murdered?
<se_high>Jessica: And the criminal was dressed like a jester.

<se_high>Jessica: It has to be Dhoulmagus!
We've got to stop him!
How many more people does he intend to kill!?

<se_def>Angelo: Golding's son and daughter have been arguing non-stop since he was killed.<page>Angelo: They should be thankful they have an inheritance at all! The Baccarat casino is a very successful business.
<se_def>Angelo: And now they want us to act as their bodyguards, while they engage in some daft contest to see who gets to take control of it!? It's ridiculous.
<se_def>Angelo: Anyway, it's taking place in the Dragon Graveyard, right? All we have to do is decide which one to go with, Cash or Carrie.

<se_low>Yangus: The bet them two kids, Cash and Carrie, 'ave got wiv each other is for the casino, innit?
Whoever wins gets to take it over.
<se_low>Yangus: And we've agreed to be bodyguards for Cash, right?
<se_low>Yangus: Well, we better go an' meet up wiv 'im then. We said we'd meet 'im at the Dragon Graveyard, right? Come on then, 'urry up!
<se_high>Jessica: We went to the Dragon Graveyard as Cash's bodyguards in this contest he's having with Carrie for the casino, right?
<se_high>Jessica: And now he's stuck inside, unconscious, all because he was trying to save Carrie from some monster.
<se_high>Jessica: Well surely it's our job as bodyguards to rescue them! Before they end up as monster snacks!
<se_def>Angelo: Now that Cash and Carrie have settled their differences, their little contest for ownership of the casino is null and void.

<se_def>Angelo: All well and good, except that now it's not just Cash we have to look after.
We've got Carrie to think about, too.
<se_def>Angelo: We had an agreement, so we can't just forget about them. Better go to the Dragon Graveyard. They'll be waiting for us.

<se_low>Yangus: The bet them two kids, Cash and Carrie, 'ave got wiv each other is for the casino, innit?
Whoever wins gets to take it over.
<se_low>Yangus: And we've agreed to look after Carrie, right?
<se_low>Yangus: Well, we better go an' meet up wiv 'er then. We said we'd meet 'er at the Dragon Graveyard, right? Come on then! Shake a leg!
<se_high>Jessica: We went to the Dragon Graveyard as Carrie's bodyguards in this contest she's having with Cash for the casino, right?
<se_high>Jessica: And now she's stuck down there, unconscious, all because she was trying to save Cash from some monster.
<se_high>Jessica: Well surely it's our job as bodyguards to rescue them! Before they both end up as monster snacks!
<se_def>Angelo: Now that Cash and Carrie have settled their differences, their little contest for ownership of the casino is null and void.

<se_def>Angelo: All well and good, except that now it's not just Carrie we have to look after.
We've got Cash to think about, too.
<se_def>Angelo: We had an agreement, so we can't just forget about them. Better go to the Dragon Graveyard. They'll be waiting for us.
<se_high>Jessica: It's great that Cash and Carrie have stopped arguing about who gets to inherit the casino. Running it together is a brilliant idea.
<se_high>Jessica: It wouldn't have been right for one to have to slink away with their tail between their legs while the other got the whole lot.
<se_high>Jessica: After all, brothers and sisters should stick together. Don't you think?
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE

<se_def>Angelo: Seeing Princess Medea as a woman rather than a horse was something of a revelation.
A rather enjoyable revelation.
<se_def>Angelo: It's not that I didn't believe she was a princess. I was just reserving judgement until I could...assess her for myself.
<se_def>Angelo: I'll be able to connect with her much better now that I've seen her. We can talk about all the things we have to go through together on our travels.
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
<se_def>Angelo: You remember the ruins on the island we went to in pursuit of Dhoulmagus after he killed that man in Baccarat?
<se_def>Angelo: You know, the ones he was hiding inside that we couldn't get into.
<se_def>Angelo: If I'm not mistaken, there were some people who turned up there just after we arrived.
<se_def>Angelo: It might be worth going back and asking them if they know anything.
<se_high>Jessica: Those people at the entrance of the Dark Ruins used to work for Golding, I think. You know, the man who Dhoulmagus killed in Baccarat.
<se_high>Jessica: They're after revenge, just like me!
<se_high>Jessica: Anyway, we know what they were there for, but we never actually asked them about Dhoulmagus. Maybe they could tell us something.
<se_high>Jessica: We should go back to the ruins and talk to them.
<se_low>Yangus: That aura around the Dark Ruins is stoppin' us gettin' in there after Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: But we found out there's somefin' in Argonia that'll 'elp us get rid of it, right.
So we better go an' get it.
<se_def>Angelo: We've been promised the magic mirror if we escort this Prince Charmles on his initiation ceremony. That's a good start.
<se_def>Angelo: It's just a shame the all-important Prince has run off and hidden himself somewhere in the castle because he doesn't want to do it.
<se_def>Angelo: We won't get anywhere until we find Prince Charmles and bring him before King Clavius.

<se_high>Jessica: Good old Munchie!
Without his help we could never have got Prince Charmles to come out of his room.
<se_high>Jessica: I don't know what that little hero did, but whatever it was, it worked! I heard the Prince scream and then he came running out!

<se_high>Jessica: I'm not sure where he went after that.
Maybe to the throne room where King Clavius was waiting for him?
<se_low>Yangus: So, this Prince Charmless finally agreed to go on this ‘a-nit-irritation ceremony’, or wotever it is, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: But no one's to know we're goin' wiv 'im!
Heh heh heh! Mum's the word! Me lips are sealed!

<se_low>Yangus: Sometimes I forget we're only doin' all this so we can get to fight Dhoulmagus.
It'll be worth it in the end, though, eh!?
<se_def>Angelo: So, it's our job to make sure that Prince Charmles defeats one of these Argon lizards in the royal hunting ground and collects its Argon heart.

<se_def>Angelo: But let's be clear about this.
We all know who'll actually be doing the fighting, right!?
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just get it over with and get that magic mirror!
<se_high>Jessica: I know technically we've already fulfilled our duty by accompanying Prince Charmles to the royal hunting ground and getting an Argon heart...
<se_high>Jessica: But if the dear Prince insists on getting a bigger one...!
<se_high>Jessica: We're just going to have to keep fighting lizards until we find an Argon heart massive enough to satisfy his king-sized demands.
<se_low>Yangus: Fightin' them Argon lizards weren't all plain sailin', eh!? But we done the right thing campin' out overnight, I reckon.
<se_low>Yangus: Mind you, I weren't 'alf surprised to wake up an' see old Charmless ridin' the 'orse-princess like 'e was in some kind o' rodeo!

<se_low>Yangus: I ain't never seen nuffin' like it!
An' as if that weren't enough, then that whoppa of a lizard turned up!
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe our little huntin' spree got the big boss a bit narked, eh!?
<se_def>Angelo: That's no mean beast stalking the royal hunting ground!
<se_def>Angelo: But if we could just defeat it, we might get an Argon heart large enough to satisfy the Prince's equally large ego.

<se_high>Jessica: Well, we've done what we were asked to do.
We fought an Argon lizard for the Prince's initiation ceremony. And a huge one at that!
<se_high>Jessica: It seems to have satisfied Prince Demanding at last!
<se_high>Jessica: Now all we need to do is deliver the little brat back to King Clavius, and our task will be complete.
<se_low>Yangus: Flamin' Ada! We finally manage to get an Argon 'eart the Prince is 'appy wiv, an' then 'e goes an' does this!

<se_low>Yangus: You know he's ditched the 'eart we got 'im, and bought another one in the bazaar!?
An' that's the one he's gonna show to the King!
<se_low>Yangus: Wot was the bleedin' point in goin' to the 'unting ground, eh!? I dunno! Anyway, I s'pose we better 'ead over to the castle an' see wot's wot.
<se_def>Angelo: Now we're in trouble!<page>Angelo: Purchasing such an enormous Argon heart at the bazaar like that only goes to prove that our Charmless Prince is sadly lacking in subtlety.
<se_def>Angelo: Deception is an art that should be left to those suave enough to pull it off. King Clavius knew exactly what he was up to!
<se_def>Angelo: I'm just glad it didn't jeopardise our chances of getting the magic mirror. Let's pick it up before the King changes his mind.
<se_high>Jessica: The whole point of getting this magic mirror was so that we could break through the aura blocking the entrance to the Dark Ruins.
<se_high>Jessica: How uncooperative of Dhoulmagus to hide himself away in such an inaccessible place!
<se_high>Jessica: But didn't that scholar man in the castle say the mirror had lost its magic?
<se_high>Jessica: You don't think that means we won't be able to use it, do you!?

<se_def>Angelo: We went to that forest to find someone who knew how to put the magic back into the mirror, correct?
<se_def>Angelo: And while we were there, we met that old man at the spring who turned the Princess back to her human form for a while.<page>Angelo: Do you see where I'm going with this?
<se_def>Angelo: If you ask me, he's our man! There's a good chance someone like him would know the secrets of the magic mirror.
<se_high>Jessica: The old man we met at that strange spring told us how we could get the magic back into the mirror.
<se_high>Jessica: We have to use the mirror to deflect a magic spell that gives off a really bright light, don't we? That'll make it magical again.
<se_high>Jessica: And he even told us where to find a monster that uses the very magic spell we need. So what are we waiting for!? Let's do it!

<se_low>Yangus: It weren't a piece o' cake by any stretch o' the imagination, but we done it!
We made the magic mirror magic again!
<se_low>Yangus: Now we're s'posed to call it the sun mirror, right?
<se_low>Yangus: So I think I'm right in sayin' that there's nuffin' stoppin' us breakin' through that aura at the Dark Ruins where Dhoulmagus is lurkin'!

<se_def>Angelo: Well, the sun mirror did the trick.
We finally managed to break down that aura around the Dark Ruins.

<se_def>Angelo: We've got him cornered now!
All we need to do is defeat Dhoulmagus and we'll have accomplished our mission.
<se_high>Jessica: It's taken us a long time to get this far, but we've finally caught up with him!
<se_high>Jessica: So what if he got the better of us last time!? We can't just give up! Let's wipe that smile off his face, once and for all!

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let all of our hard work go to waste!
It's time for revenge!
<se_low>Yangus: Dhoulmagus thought 'e was gonna finish us off wiv that thorn curse of 'is!

<se_low>Yangus: But it didn't work on us, eh!?
Cor, 'e weren't best pleased about that, was 'e!?
He's a right ugly beggar in 'is true form an' all!

<se_low>Yangus: We ain't backin' down now!
Just cos 'e beat us before, it don't mean we can't take 'im! He's 'istory!

<se_def>Angelo: Well at least we did what we set out to do.
Dhoulmagus is no more!
<se_def>Angelo: But why on earth haven't the Princess and King Trode turned back to normal? It's been a journey of revelations, but I didn't see this one coming.

<se_def>Angelo: And now Jessica's disappeared as well!
We're not having a lot of luck, are we?
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
DUMMY MESSAGE
<se_def>Angelo: I can't believe Jessica's gone and vanished just when it seemed like there was a party on the cards!<page>Angelo: We defeated Dhoulmagus! We should be celebrating!
<se_def>Angelo: But now our top priority has to be finding her.

<se_def>Angelo: That disturbance we witnessed in Arcadia is really playing on my mind.
Maybe we should start looking there.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot the 'ell is Jessica up to!?
Has she lost the plot or wot!?

<se_low>Yangus: That Dominico geezer's a waste o' space, if you ask me.
He was really windin' me up!
<se_low>Yangus: He's gone an' made me forget wot we was doin'!
<se_low>Yangus: I wish we didn't 'ave to, but we're gonna 'ave to go back an' talk to 'im again or I ain't gonna remember.
<se_def>Angelo: Didn't Jessica say that we were quicker than she expected, when we found her with Dominico?

<se_def>Angelo: Which means she knew we were coming...and she planned for it.
I really don't know what's got into her.

<se_def>Angelo: Still, no point trying to figure women out.
Don't want to spoil the fun!
Anyway, you've got the stone sword, right?
<se_def>Angelo: Then let's go east to this tower and see if it really does open the door like we were told.

<se_low>Yangus: I tell ya, if that Rydon really did make a
tower like that all on 'is tod, then he's no
ordin'ry bloke!

<se_low>Yangus: I like 'im.
He's the sort o' bloke ya can rely on.
Wot was it 'e said now...?

<se_low>Yangus: That's it! Alexandra.
The name of 'is ancestor.
That's wot we gotta focus on!

<se_def>Angelo: We can't afford to waste too much time.
We don't know when the deranged Jessica will decide to attack Arcadia again.
<se_def>Angelo: We should deliver the Kran Spinels donated by the rather charming Alexandra to that well-fed wizard in Arcadia.
<se_low>Yangus: That bloke we met in the town over the straits, Arcadia...

<se_low>Yangus: He makes me wanna throw up, 'e does!
Wot's his name? Dominico, right?

<se_low>Yangus: He ain't no 'uman! Human's 'ave got 'earts.
But 'e ain't, that's for sure! He's a bleedin' monster!

<se_low>Yangus: An' now we've gotta go back there!
Life's 'ard sometimes, eh?

<se_def>Angelo: We haven't got any choice.
We have to fight Jessica.
However foul her mood may be.
<se_def>Angelo: I know how you feel. I'm not exactly sure about it myself, but there's no other way. We must stop her.

<se_def>Angelo: Look, it's not my style to cross a lady.
But this is the only way.

<se_def>Angelo: No one else can stand up to her.
We have to take Jessica on!
No holding back!
<se_low>Yangus: Well we've got rid o' Dhoulmagus, and Jessica's back to 'er usual self.
<se_low>Yangus: Now if we can just find that sceptre Jessica was on about, ev'ryfin'll be sweet.

<se_low>Yangus: Well, apart from the old codger, of course. He still looks a bit funny.
Still, that's nuffin' to worry about, eh?
Jessica: ......

<se_high>Jessica: I feel awful.
David's dead because of me.

<se_high>Jessica: I have to defeat Leopold!
Otherwise, I'll never be able to forgive myself!
<se_high>Jessica: Dominico said that Leopold left Arcadia and headed north, didn't he?

<se_high>Jessica: We still haven't got any clues as to where Leopold is.
<se_high>Jessica: I suppose we'd better look for this man Marek, who Marta asked us to find.

<se_low>Yangus: We're lookin' for this doctor bloke, Marek, right?
The one old Marta asked us to find.

<se_low>Yangus: But it don't look like he's anywhere in Orkutsk.
Where d'ya reckon he's got to?
<se_high>Jessica: Orkutsk is full of distractions, I know, but you haven't forgotten that man we found in the cave to the northwest, have you?

<se_high>Jessica: There's a good chance that was Marek.
We can't just leave him in there.
We've got to go and help him right now!
<se_def>Angelo: Dodging falling icicles and being attacked by wolves! Helping Marek turned out to be trickier than I imagined.
<se_def>Angelo: Didn't he say he wanted to talk to us about something? I'm sure he asked us to meet him in his room.

<se_def>Angelo: You'd forgotten, hadn't you?
Where would you be without me, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: I never thought that old woman would turn out to be one o' the sage's heirs! Here, wasn't it them heirs wot that big black dog was attac<endash>

<se_low>Yangus: Strike a light!
It'll be after old Marta then!
We better get over to 'er place right now!
<se_high>Jessica: Leopold flew off towards the island where the Lord High Priest lives.
<se_high>Jessica: This stuff about the Godbird Empyrea is fascinating and everything, but first things first! We've got to go after the dog!
<se_low>Yangus: This treasure 'unt's turned into a bit of a race wiv Red!

<se_low>Yangus: But we ain't got time for none o' that nonsense!
Let's get movin'!

<se_low>Yangus: Things got a bit 'airy when Red went an' touched Captain Crow's treasure chest, right?
That's when the old pirate's ghost appeared.

<se_low>Yangus: He gave us a good beatin', eh, bu<endash>
Hang on a minute! Wot 'appened to Red!?

<se_low>Yangus: She ain't still stuck in the cave is she!?
We've gotta get back in there and defeat that Captain Crow!
<se_def>Angelo: What do you suppose that illuminated sea chart is exactly? Was it really worth struggling through the pirate's cove for?
<se_def>Angelo: I guess all we can do is try sailing along the course that's plotted on it and see what happens.

<se_high>Jessica: Well Godbird Island is real enough.
But do you think there is actually a Godbird?
You know, this Empyrea we've heard about.
<se_high>Jessica: We should listen to what the people of Empycchu have to say about it.
<se_def>Angelo: So the Empycchu village chief thinks we can get into some other world by following Empyrea's shadow!?
<se_def>Angelo: Well I'd like to meet this Godbird as much as the next man, but you can count me out of this one!
<se_def>Angelo: You should think about giving these crazy ideas a rest too!
<se_low>Yangus: After followin' this Empyrea's shadow an' all that, an' gettin' into an 'ole other world, I thought it'd be a bit different.
<se_low>Yangus: But it's exactly like the one we just came from! I s'pose they've prob'ly got towns an' villages an ev'ryfin' too.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's go an' see wot's about, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: Well we know that Empyrea is more than just a shadow now.
And the Godbird seems to have an attitude problem!
<se_high>Jessica: But after everything we've heard, I can't believe Empyrea is a bad creature.
<se_high>Jessica: Don't you think we should talk to the people from the World of Darkness a bit more?
<se_def>Angelo: The chief wants us to find out why Empyrea's been acting so violently, does he?

<se_def>Angelo: Sounds like she's often around that stone perch on the hill.
So, shall we take a look?
<se_low>Yangus: All we was doin' was askin' a question, an' that bird goes an' attacks us!

<se_low>Yangus: Wot's its problem, eh!?
We ain't gonna let it get away wiv that, are we!?
Time to make some pigeon pie!

<se_high>Jessica: Poor Empyrea!
With her egg held hostage, you can hardly blame her for doing what she did.
<se_high>Jessica: Even if Empyrea hadn't asked us to help, there's no way I'd let this Gemon creature get away with such a despicable trick!
<se_high>Jessica: Let's go to her nest right now and give this Gemon what's coming to him!

<se_def>Angelo: Of all the rotten luck...!
We were so close to defeating Gemon and saving Empyrea's egg!

<se_def>Angelo: I know it's tough getting up there, but we've got to go back!
We can't just forget about this.
<se_high>Jessica: Isn't it amazing!? Empyrea's chick turned itself into this soulstone, and now we can use it to fly!
<se_high>Jessica: We'll be able to go to all kinds of places we couldn't get to before. Mountain tops, secluded valleys surrounded by cliffs, anywhere!

<se_high>Jessica: It's great that we can fly now, but it's not helping us track down Leopold.
<se_high>Jessica: But we should be able to use that Darktree leaf we got before to find him, right?

<se_high>Jessica: So come on! Let's get after him!
I've got a score to settle with that dog!
A personal one!

<se_def>Angelo: So the dog was heading for Savella Cathedral of all places!
It's pretty clear who its next target is.
<se_def>Angelo: It, or rather Rhapthorne, must be planning to kill the Lord High Priest.
<se_def>Angelo: Well he'll have to get through me first!

<se_low>Yangus: You saw it too, right!?
That Rhapthorne dog-thingy flyin' into the Gaffer Priest's room through the window!
<se_low>Yangus: Rhapthorne's gonna try an' kill 'im now an' all!
<se_low>Yangus: Come on! We've gotta make ourselves into the bird and fly in there as well! No time to lose!
<se_high>Jessica: If we don't protect the Lord High Priest's life, Rhapthorne will be free to destroy our world. He'll turn it into another World of Darkness.
<se_high>Jessica: He's controlling the dog. We've got to defeat it before it's too late. Come on! Let's get back to the Lord High Priest's chamber!

<se_low>Yangus: I saw it wiv me own eyes!
After we gave that dog wot for, it was Marcello who picked up the sceptre.
<se_low>Yangus: If you ask me, Rhapthorne made 'im lock us up down 'ere cos 'e reckons the guv's gonna stop 'im breakin' the seal.

<se_low>Yangus: We need to get out of 'ere quick.
Otherwise the Lord 'Igh Priest's gonna be in a load o' trouble!
<se_high>Jessica: I don't know how far we can trust those prison guards, but I do believe them about the Lord High Priest being dead.
<se_high>Jessica: Marcello must have done it. So long as he's holding that sceptre, he'll do everything Rhapthorne tells him to do.

<se_high>Jessica: But what can we do?
Stuck down here, our hands are tied.

<se_high>Jessica: We've got to get out.
Somehow, we've got to escape.
<se_low>Yangus: I'd almost forgotten about them moles we came across when we were gettin' that Moonshadow 'arp.<page>Yangus: I never thought they'd make a new hideout in that dungeon!
<se_low>Yangus: An' can ya believe the gaffer mole even went an' cleared away that rubble wot was blockin' the way out for us!
<se_low>Yangus: That's the kind o' thing true mates do for each other!
<se_def>Angelo: I imagined we'd find the whole world in turmoil when we got off Purgatory Island. What's Rhapthorne up to?
<se_def>Angelo: I find it hard to believe he's been doing nothing since he brought about the death of the Lord High Priest. Lying low isn't his style.

<se_def>Angelo: Hmm...
I have a bad feeling about this...
We need more information.

<se_high>Jessica: Marcello's on the Holy Isle of Neos.
There's no way he could know we've escaped from Purgatory Island, is there?

<se_high>Jessica: No, wait a minute. It's not Marcello, is it?
He's being controlled by the sceptre.
It's Rhapthorne really.

<se_high>Jessica: There's no way of knowing what he's planning.
But this is going to be our last chance to stop him.

<se_high>Jessica: We've got to defeat Rhapthorne and get back the sceptre.
So come on! To Neos!
<se_low>Yangus: Marcello's tryin' to use Rhapthorne's power wiv that sceptre to start a war or somefin'!

<se_low>Yangus: Wot's 'is game, eh!?
He's worse than Rhapthorne 'imself!
<se_low>Yangus: Anyway, we've gotta get back to Neos an' take that sceptre off Marcello, 'fore 'e lands 'imself and ev'ryone else right in it!
<se_high>Jessica: Now that Rhapthorne's killed all of the great sages' heirs and consumed the Goddess statue on Neos, his resurrection is complete.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess we couldn't stop him regaining his physical form. I'm not sure where he flew off to, but he's around. Somewhere up in the sky.
<se_high>Jessica: Neos has been completely destroyed. So many people have died. But we can't afford to let ourselves think about that now.
<se_high>Jessica: We're the only ones who can stop Rhapthorne. We have to go after him! We have to fight him! And we have to win!

<se_high>Jessica: I know Rhapthorne just beat us, and we don't know if we'll be able to turn it around the next time we take him on, but...things aren't all bad.
<se_high>Jessica: I mean, the Lord of Darkness can't run away from us any more.

<se_low>Yangus: Crikey...
It's all go round 'ere now, eh!?

<se_low>Yangus: We all know the score, right?

<se_low>Yangus: Look up in the sky!
That's wot we've gotta do!
Up there!
<se_def>Angelo: I probably shouldn't tell you this, but...
<se_def>Angelo: I was intending to bow out of this little adventure of yours when the time was right.
<se_def>Angelo: It's not that I don't want to avenge Abbot Francisco's murder. I do. I just wanted to show the Templars they couldn't boss me around.

<se_def>Angelo: But, don't worry.
I'll see this through.
I've come too far to turn back now.
<se_high>Jessica: Rhapthorne has finally revealed his true form, but we can't touch him behind that dark shield of his.
<se_high>Jessica: According to Empyrea, the only way to break through it is by collecting the seven orbs that contain the power of the legendary seven sages.
<se_high>Jessica: That means, once we get our hands on them, we'll be able to fight Rhapthorne just like we would any other monster!
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, we don't have any time to lose! Let's use that echo flute Empyrea gave us and find the seven orbs!

<se_def>Angelo: I had a really strange dream the other day.
<se_def>Angelo: I was on the top of some mountain, when suddenly a strange emblem appeared on a stone monument there. I wonder where I was exactly.
<se_low>Yangus: You know that weird cave we ended up in when we 'ad a look at that stone monument-thingy wiv the emblem?
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder wot's in there, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: Who'd have thought the stone tablet would end up leading us to a whole new race!?
I'd never even heard of the Dragovians before!
<se_high>Jessica: And what about that strange old man?
<se_high>Jessica: I don't know if it's the way he acts or his hair or what, but there's something strangely familiar about Chen Mui.

<se_def>Angelo: What were they saying about the cause of the Dragovian Sanctuary's fall into ruin?<page>Angelo: Something about the Lord of the Dragovians messing up a ritual to rid himself of his human form?
<se_def>Angelo: The cheek! And to add insult to injury, he's now gone a bit crazy, so would we mind terribly running along and sorting him out!?

<se_def>Angelo: Unbelievable!
Just when we were about to go and fight Rhapthorne!
<se_high>Jessica: If we don't fight the Lord of the Dragovians, this whole place will be wiped out, won't it?

<se_high>Jessica: What are we waiting for, then!?
He's on the Heavenly Dais, right?
Let's get over there!

<se_low>Yangus: That Lord o' the Dragovians is out o' control!
He gave us a bit of a thrashin' there, didn't 'e?

<se_low>Yangus: But we can't let 'im go on like this, or them Dragovians, the village and their sank<->cherry<->wotsit are all done for!<page>Yangus: We've gotta give 'im a good 'idin'! That'll learn 'im!
<se_high>Jessica: Wow! Who could have predicted that defeating the Lord of the Dragovians would kick up such shocking revelations about one of our own party!?

<se_high>Jessica: So...what should we do now?
Do we take the Dragovian Trials, or do we go and fight Rhapthorne?
<se_high>Jessica: I'll go along with whatever everyone decides.

<se_def>Angelo: Let me get this straight.
We're just going through these trials because the Lord of the Dragovians asked us to, correct?

<se_def>Angelo: Well, trials aren't really my thing, you know.
But if I know you, you'll be planning on having another crack at them. Please tell me I'm wrong.

<se_def>Angelo: Aaah, the things I do for you!
All right, I'll play along!
I suppose it's sort of like a game...
!!! End of ARASUJI !!!
